sub_topic: Probability of a certain stock price change
message_1: Assume the probability of a certain stock price increase is 0.45 and the probability of its decrease is 0.25. If the stock has a probability of neither increasing nor decreasing of 0.3, what is the chance that the stock will either increase or decrease in price?
message_2:
To find the probability that the stock will either increase or decrease in price, we simply add the probabilities of each event occurring:

P(increase) + P(decrease) = 0.45 + 0.25 = 0.7

So, the chance that the stock will either increase or decrease in price is 0.7 or 70%.
